description: A set of command-line instructions used to restart Windows Update services and rename the software distribution folder to resolve installation issues. This tool utilizes commands to stop the Windows Update service (wuauserv) and the Background Intelligent Transfer Service (bits), rename the software distribution folder to create a backup, and then restart the services to apply changes. The steps help in clearing out any corrupted or old files that may be causing installation failures for Windows updates. This approach can be particularly useful when troubleshooting failed updates related to Windows operating system installations.

metadata.synthesized_code:
cmd net stop wuauserv
cmd net stop bits
ren c:\windows\softwaredistribution softwaredistribution.old2
cmd net start wuauserv
cmd net start bits (LLM Synthesized)
